cards.flavor:
"When you have been bitten with fangs of granite, you start to long for the ivory sabers of tigers."
—Norin the Wary
cards.name: Animate Wall
cards.text:
Enchant Wall
Enchanted Wall can attack as though it didn't have defender.

cards.flavor:
"My mother once told me angels sing their swords' names with each strike."
—Sisay, Captain of the Weatherlight
cards.name: Archangel
cards.text: Flying, vigilance

cards.flavor: Some fight for honor and some for gold, but the militia fight for hearth and home.
cards.name: Ardent Militia
cards.text: Vigilance

cards.name: Armageddon
cards.text: Destroy all lands.

cards.flavor: Asked how it survived a run-in with a bog imp, the pegasus just shook its mane and burped.
cards.name: Armored Pegasus
cards.text: Flying

cards.flavor:
"Hang out our banners on the outward walls; / The cry is still, ‘They come'; our castle's strength / Will laugh a siege to scorn."
—William Shakespeare, Macbeth
cards.name: Castle
cards.text: Untapped creatures you control get +0/+2.

cards.name: Celestial Dawn
cards.text:
Lands you control are Plains.
Nonland cards you own that aren't on the battlefield, spells you control, and nonland permanents you control are white.
You may spend white mana as though it were mana of any color. You may spend other mana only as though it were colorless mana.

cards.name: Circle of Protection: Black
cards.text: {1}: The next time a black source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

cards.name: Circle of Protection: Blue
cards.text: {1}: The next time a blue source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

cards.name: Circle of Protection: Green
cards.text: {1}: The next time a green source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

cards.name: Circle of Protection: Red
cards.text: {1}: The next time a red source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

cards.name: Circle of Protection: White
cards.text: {1}: The next time a white source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

cards.name: Crusade
cards.text: White creatures get +1/+1.

cards.flavor: Avenant's archers are also trained as poets, so that each arrow is guided by a fragment of verse.
cards.name: D'Avenant Archer
cards.text: {T}: D'Avenant Archer deals 1 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.

cards.flavor:
"And the flamingos said, ‘Get out of our nest—we can't be seen with the likes of you!' So, the griffin ate them."
—Azeworai, "The Ugly Bird"
cards.name: Daraja Griffin
cards.text:
Flying
Sacrifice Daraja Griffin: Destroy target black creature.

cards.name: Disenchant
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.

cards.flavor: Glory surged through her and radiance surrounded her. All things were possible with the blessing of the Divine.
cards.name: Divine Transformation
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/+3.

cards.flavor:
"My goat was a small price to pay for the chance to see the hunting griffin dive and seize it."
—Suq'Ata trader
cards.name: Ekundu Griffin
cards.text: Flying, first strike

cards.flavor:
"I do not teach. I simply reveal."
—Daudi, Femeref tutor
cards.name: Enlightened Tutor
cards.text: Search your library for an artifact or enchantment card and reveal that card. Shuffle your library, then put the card on top of it.

cards.flavor:
"If I have learned anything as a wizard it is this: never fight your own battles."
—Waffa, sorcerer of Nyomba
cards.name: Ethereal Champion
cards.text: Pay 1 life: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to Ethereal Champion this turn.

cards.name: Exile
cards.text: Exile target nonwhite attacking creature. You gain life equal to its toughness.

cards.name: Healing Salve
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Target player gains 3 life.
• Prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.

cards.flavor:
"Archers, ballistae—you can't even get near the island of Avenant."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight
cards.name: Heavy Ballista
cards.text: {T}: Heavy Ballista deals 2 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.

cards.flavor:
"Destiny, chance, fate, fortune—they're all just ways of claiming your successes without claiming your failures."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight
cards.name: Hero's Resolve
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+5.

cards.flavor: Icatia's once-peaceful towns faced increasing attacks from orcs and goblins as the climate cooled. By the time the empire fell, they were little more than armed camps.
cards.name: Icatian Town
cards.text: Create four 1/1 white Citizen creature tokens.

cards.flavor:
"The true dishonor for a soldier is surviving the war."
—Telim'Tor
cards.name: Infantry Veteran
cards.text: {T}: Target attacking creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
"Make people wait for what they want, and you have power over them. This is as true for merchants and militia as it is for cooks and couples."
—Gwendlyn Di Corci
cards.name: Kismet
cards.text: Artifacts, creatures, and lands played by your opponents enter the battlefield tapped.

cards.flavor:
Honorable in battle, generous in death.
—Motto of the Kjeldoran Royal Guard
cards.name: Kjeldoran Royal Guard
cards.text: {T}: All combat damage that would be dealt to you by unblocked creatures this turn is dealt to Kjeldoran Royal Guard instead.

cards.flavor:
"I do not miss sunlight. The very memory of it burns my eyes."
—Volrath
cards.name: Light of Day
cards.text: Black creatures can't attack or block.

cards.flavor:
"If it bears wings, I will pin it to the skies over Tefemburu."
—Roya, Zhalfirin archer
cards.name: Longbow Archer
cards.text: First strike; reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)

cards.flavor:
"The faith of Serra is borne on wings of hope."
—Gulsen, abbey matron
cards.name: Mesa Falcon
cards.text:
Flying
{1}{W}: Mesa Falcon gets +0/+1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: A blazing light to drive out the shadows.
cards.name: Order of the Sacred Torch
cards.text: {T}, Pay 1 life: Counter target black spell.

cards.flavor: For the first time in his life, Grakk felt a little warm and fuzzy inside.
cards.name: Pacifism
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block.

cards.flavor:
"They knew Bantau was lost when, to hide the pearl he had found on the beach, he swallowed it—and soon grew wings."
—Hakim, Loreweaver
cards.name: Pearl Dragon
cards.text:
Flying
{1}{W}: Pearl Dragon gets +0/+1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Unicorns don't care if you believe in them any more than you care if they believe in you.
cards.name: Regal Unicorn

cards.flavor:
"These things will protect you while I'm gone, remind you of my love for you."
—"Love Song of Night and Day"
cards.name: Remedy
cards.text: Prevent the next 5 damage that would be dealt this turn to any number of target creatures and/or players, divided as you choose.

cards.flavor:
"The meek shall fight as one, and they shall overcome even the greatest of foes."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran priest
cards.name: Reprisal
cards.text: Destroy target creature with power 4 or greater. It can't be regenerated.

cards.flavor:
"My soldiers fought without hesitation, died without doubt."
—Sidar Jabari
cards.name: Resistance Fighter
cards.text: Sacrifice Resistance Fighter: Prevent all combat damage target creature would deal this turn.

cards.name: Reverse Damage
cards.text: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage. You gain life equal to the damage prevented this way.

cards.flavor: Healers ultimately acquire the divine gifts of spiritual and physical wholeness. The most devout are also granted the ability to pass physical wholeness on to others.
cards.name: Samite Healer
cards.text: {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.

cards.flavor:
"Just think of me as the storm before the calm."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight
cards.name: Serenity
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, destroy all artifacts and enchantments. They can't be regenerated.

cards.flavor:
"I have seen your strength imbued in angels' wings, and I have felt your sorrow rain down on the ruins brought by the Lord of the Wastes."
—Hanna, Weatherlight navigator
cards.name: Serra's Blessing
cards.text: Creatures you control have vigilance. (Attacking doesn't cause them to tap.)

cards.name: Spirit Link
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Whenever enchanted creature deals damage, you gain that much life.

cards.flavor: The less you have, the harder you fight for it.
cards.name: Standing Troops
cards.text: Vigilance

cards.flavor:
"Hold your position! Leave doubt for the dying!"
—Tahngarth of the Weatherlight
cards.name: Staunch Defenders
cards.text: When Staunch Defenders enters the battlefield, you gain 4 life.

cards.flavor:
"There is no sweeter music than the wails of a dying dragon."
—Rashida Scalebane
cards.name: Sunweb
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Flying
Sunweb can't block creatures with power 2 or less.

cards.name: Tariff
cards.text: Each player sacrifices the creature he or she controls with the highest converted mana cost unless he or she pays that creature's mana cost. If two or more creatures a player controls are tied for highest cost, that player chooses one.

cards.flavor: I heard their eerie howling, the wolves calling their kindred across the frozen plains.
cards.name: Tundra Wolves
cards.text: First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)

cards.flavor: The griffin's shadow gives courage to the righteous and dread to the idle.
cards.name: Unyaro Griffin
cards.text:
Flying
Sacrifice Unyaro Griffin: Counter target red instant or sorcery spell.

cards.flavor: His presence brings not only a strong arm but also renewed hope.
cards.name: Venerable Monk
cards.text: When Venerable Monk enters the battlefield, you gain 2 life.

cards.flavor: Sharper than wind, lighter than air.
cards.name: Wall of Swords
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Flying

cards.flavor:
"Flame grows gentle with but a little distance."
—Orim, Samite healer
cards.name: Warmth
cards.text: Whenever an opponent casts a red spell, you gain 2 life.

cards.name: Warrior's Honor
cards.text: Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Wrath of God
cards.text: Destroy all creatures. They can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Abduction
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When Abduction enters the battlefield, untap enchanted creature.
You control enchanted creature.
When enchanted creature dies, return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control.

cards.flavor: As insubstantial, and as powerful, as the wind that carries it.
cards.name: Air Elemental
cards.text: Flying

cards.name: Ancestral Memories
cards.text: Look at the top seven cards of your library. Put two of them into your hand and the rest into your graveyard.

cards.flavor: A lie always returns; be careful how you catch it.
cards.name: Boomerang
cards.text: Return target permanent to its owner's hand.

cards.flavor:
"Once great literature—now great litter."
—Jaya Ballard, task mage
cards.name: Browse
cards.text: {2}{U}{U}: Look at the top five cards of your library, put one of them into your hand, and exile the rest.

cards.flavor:
"Temper, temper."
—Ertai, wizard adept
cards.name: Chill
cards.text: Red spells cost {2} more to cast.

cards.name: Counterspell
cards.text: Counter target spell.

cards.flavor: In front of every great wizard is a doomed apprentice.
cards.name: Daring Apprentice
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Daring Apprentice: Counter target spell.

cards.flavor:
Up and down,
over and through,
back around—
the joke's on you.
cards.name: Deflection
cards.text: Change the target of target spell with a single target.

cards.flavor: First the insult, then the injury.
cards.name: Desertion
cards.text: Counter target spell. If an artifact or creature spell is countered this way, put that card onto the battlefield under your control instead of into its owner's graveyard.

cards.name: Diminishing Returns
cards.text: Each player shuffles his or her hand and graveyard into his or her library. You exile the top ten cards of your library. Then each player draws up to seven cards.

cards.flavor:
Dreams' riches are easily spent.
—Suq'Ata adage
cards.name: Dream Cache
cards.text: Draw three cards, then put two cards from your hand both on top of your library or both on the bottom of your library.

cards.name: Flash
cards.text: You may put a creature card from your hand onto the battlefield. If you do, sacrifice it unless you pay its mana cost reduced by up to {2}.

cards.name: Flight
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has flying.

cards.flavor:
"I've seen fog so thick you could cut it, but none that could cut me."
—Tahngarth of the Weatherlight
cards.name: Fog Elemental
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
When Fog Elemental attacks or blocks, sacrifice it at end of combat.

cards.name: Forget
cards.text: Target player discards two cards, then draws as many cards as he or she discarded this way.

cards.name: Gaseous Form
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by enchanted creature.

cards.flavor:
"Huge walls of ice block further travel. We can't believe they are natural."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry
cards.name: Glacial Wall
cards.text: Defender (This creature can't attack.)

cards.flavor:
"One moment I was walking along the beach, and the next I was high in the air, staring into a hideous smiling face."
—Tarub, Suq'Ata sailor
cards.name: Harmattan Efreet
cards.text:
Flying
{1}{U}{U}: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
"So like men are they: a hardened shell with fragile flesh beneath."
—Selenia, dark angel
cards.name: Horned Turtle

cards.flavor:
"We can fight with you or against you. After my day, I'd prefer the former."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight
cards.name: Insight
cards.text: Whenever an opponent casts a green spell, you draw a card.

cards.flavor:
"Madness and genius are separated only by degrees of success."
—Sidar Jabari
cards.name: Inspiration
cards.text: Target player draws two cards.

cards.name: Juxtapose
cards.text: You and target player exchange control of the creature you each control with the highest converted mana cost. Then exchange control of artifacts the same way. If two or more permanents a player controls are tied for highest cost, their controller chooses one of them.

cards.name: Library of Lat-Nam
cards.text:
An opponent chooses one —
• You draw three cards at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
• You search your library for a card, put that card into your hand, then shuffle your library.

cards.flavor: A master of tactics, the lord of Atlantis makes his people bold in battle merely by arriving to lead them.
cards.name: Lord of Atlantis
cards.text: Other Merfolk creatures get +1/+1 and have islandwalk. (They can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)

cards.name: Mana Short
cards.text: Tap all lands target player controls and empty his or her mana pool.

cards.flavor:
"Um . . . oh . . . what was I saying?"
—Reveka, wizard savant
cards.name: Memory Lapse
cards.text: Counter target spell. If that spell is countered this way, put it on top of its owner's library instead of into that player's graveyard.

cards.flavor: Are merfolk humans with fins, or are humans merfolk with feet?
cards.name: Merfolk of the Pearl Trident

cards.flavor:
"To the tutors, a ‘poem of sand' was of little account, a ‘poem of ivory,' priceless."
—Afari, Tales
cards.name: Mystical Tutor
cards.text: Search your library for an instant or sorcery card and reveal that card. Shuffle your library, then put the card on top of it.

cards.name: Phantasmal Terrain
cards.text:
Enchant land
As Phantasmal Terrain enters the battlefield, choose a basic land type.
Enchanted land is the chosen type.

cards.flavor: The phantom warrior comes from nowhere and returns there just as quickly.
cards.name: Phantom Warrior
cards.text: Phantom Warrior can't be blocked.

cards.flavor: "Ahh! Opposable digits!"
cards.name: Polymorph
cards.text: Destroy target creature. It can't be regenerated. Its controller reveals cards from the top of his or her library until he or she reveals a creature card. The player puts that card onto the battlefield, then shuffles all other cards revealed this way into his or her library.

cards.name: Power Sink
cards.text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {X}. If he or she doesn't, that player taps all lands with mana abilities he or she controls and empties his or her mana pool.

cards.flavor: Occasionally members of the Institute of Arcane Study acquire a taste for worldly pleasures. Seldom do they have trouble finding employment.
cards.name: Prodigal Sorcerer
cards.text: {T}: Prodigal Sorcerer deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.flavor:
"Wealth is a good thing, compared to poverty—your food is better, your robes are softer, and your companions have bathed more recently."
—Kukemssa pirate
cards.name: Prosperity
cards.text: Each player draws X cards.

cards.flavor:
"The memory of your existence will fade like the final stars of morning."
—Kaervek
cards.name: Psychic Transfer
cards.text: If the difference between your life total and target player's life total is 5 or less, exchange life totals with that player.

cards.name: Psychic Venom
cards.text:
Enchant land
Whenever enchanted land becomes tapped, Psychic Venom deals 2 damage to that land's controller.

cards.name: Recall
cards.text: Discard X cards, then return a card from your graveyard to your hand for each card discarded this way. Exile Recall.

cards.flavor:
"Barrin taught me that the hardest lessons to grasp are the ones you've already learned."
—Ertai, wizard adept
cards.name: Relearn
cards.text: Return target instant or sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.flavor: Nethya stiffened suddenly, head cocked as if straining to hear some distant sound, then fell lifeless to the ground.
cards.name: Remove Soul
cards.text: Counter target creature spell.

cards.flavor: The owl asks but never answers.
cards.name: Sage Owl
cards.text:
Flying
When Sage Owl enters the battlefield, look at the top four cards of your library, then put them back in any order.

cards.flavor: Water is life. Or perhaps it is just something to wash it down with.
cards.name: Sea Monster
cards.text: Sea Monster can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.

cards.flavor:
"Leviathan, too! Can you catch him with a fish-hook or run a line round his tongue?"
—The Bible, Job 41:1
cards.name: Segovian Leviathan
cards.text: Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)

cards.flavor: She had expected death to roar, to thunder, to growl. She did not recognize it when it came hissing to her side.
cards.name: Sibilant Spirit
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Sibilant Spirit attacks, defending player may draw a card.

cards.flavor:
"To hide the truth is more than folly—it is fatal."
—Sorine Relicbane, Soldevi heretic
cards.name: Soldevi Sage
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice two lands: Draw three cards, then discard one of them.

cards.flavor: Call it the thinking mage's version of brute force.
cards.name: Spell Blast
cards.text: Counter target spell with converted mana cost X. (For example, if that spell's mana cost is {3}{U}{U}, X is 5.)

cards.flavor:
Storm crow descending, winter unending.
Storm crow departing, summer is starting.
cards.name: Storm Crow
cards.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)

cards.flavor:
"It is nature that gives us our boundaries and nature that enforces them."
—Eladamri, Lord of Leaves
cards.name: Tidal Surge
cards.text: Tap up to three target creatures without flying.

cards.name: Unsummon
cards.text: Return target creature to its owner's hand.

cards.flavor:
"Vodalian rank is displayed by the colors and patterns of their skin. Beware the color red; that is the badge of the empress's favor."
—Corbio, pearl diver
cards.name: Vodalian Soldiers

cards.flavor:
When no falcons fly, beware the sky.
—Femeref aphorism
cards.name: Wall of Air
cards.text: Defender, flying (This creature can't attack, and it can block creatures with flying.)

cards.flavor:
"No bird soars too high, if he soars with his own wings."
—William Blake,
The Marriage of Heaven and Hell
cards.name: Wind Drake
cards.text: Flying

cards.flavor:
" . . . When the trees bow down their heads,
The wind is passing by."
—Christina Rossetti,
"Who Has Seen the Wind?"
cards.name: Wind Spirit
cards.text:
Flying
Menace (This creature can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)

cards.name: Zur's Weirding
cards.text:
Players play with their hands revealed.
If a player would draw a card, he or she reveals it instead. Then any other player may pay 2 life. If a player does, put that card into its owner's graveyard. Otherwise, that player draws a card.

cards.flavor: Some smiles show cheer; some merely show teeth.
cards.name: Abyssal Hunter
cards.text: {B}, {T}: Tap target creature. Abyssal Hunter deals damage equal to Abyssal Hunter's power to that creature.

cards.name: Abyssal Specter
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Abyssal Specter deals damage to a player, that player discards a card.

cards.flavor:
"An innocent man died because of my anger. That knowledge will haunt me for all eternity."
—Karn, silver golem
cards.name: Agonizing Memories
cards.text: Look at target player's hand and choose two cards from it. Put them on top of that player's library in any order.

cards.flavor:
"What you call decay, I call ripening. You'll gain no sustenance from this harvest."
—Kaervek
cards.name: Ashen Powder
cards.text: Put target creature card from an opponent's graveyard onto the battlefield under your control.

cards.name: Blight
cards.text:
Enchant land
When enchanted land becomes tapped, destroy it.

cards.name: Blighted Shaman
cards.text:
{T}, Sacrifice a Swamp: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
{T}, Sacrifice a creature: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: "You are wrong," Volrath said. "I do not hate the living. They often prove quite useful to me." And then he laughed.
cards.name: Blood Pet
cards.text: Sacrifice Blood Pet: Add {B} to your mana pool.

cards.flavor: Don't be fooled by their looks. Think of them as little knives with wings.
cards.name: Bog Imp
cards.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)

cards.flavor: Their stench was vile and strong enough, but not nearly as powerful as their hunger.
cards.name: Bog Rats
cards.text: Bog Rats can't be blocked by Walls.

cards.flavor: It moved through the troops leaving no footprints, save on their souls.
cards.name: Bog Wraith
cards.text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)

cards.flavor:
A rhino's bargain
—Femeref expression meaning
"a situation with no choices"
cards.name: Coercion
cards.text: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose a card from it. That player discards that card.

cards.flavor:
"Strength it has, but at the cost of a continuous supply of energy. Such failure can bear only one result."
—Execution order of Endrek Sahr,
master breeder
cards.name: Derelor
cards.text: Black spells you cast cost {B} more to cast.

cards.name: Doomsday
cards.text: Search your library and graveyard for five cards and exile the rest. Put the chosen cards on top of your library in any order. You lose half your life, rounded up.

cards.flavor:
"These moonless, foreign skies keep me in thrall. Dark whispers echo in the night, and I cannot resist."
—Selenia, dark angel
cards.name: Dread of Night
cards.text: White creatures get -1/-1.

cards.flavor:
"The dead make good soldiers. They can't disobey orders, they never surrender, and they don't stop fighting when a random body part falls off."
—Nevinyrral, Necromancer's Handbook
cards.name: Drudge Skeletons
cards.text: {B}: Regenerate Drudge Skeletons. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)

cards.flavor:
"Wherever water is lacking, all things suffer."
—Autumn Willow
cards.name: Dry Spell
cards.text: Dry Spell deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.

cards.flavor:
"If it is weak, either kill it or ignore it. Anything else honors it."
—Kaervek
cards.name: Enfeeblement
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature gets -2/-2.

cards.flavor: The highway of fear is the shortest route to defeat.
cards.name: Evil Eye of Orms-by-Gore
cards.text:
Non-Eye creatures you control can't attack.
Evil Eye of Orms-by-Gore can't be blocked except by Walls.

cards.flavor: "Angels are simply extensions of truth upon the fabric of life—and there is far more dark than light." —Baron Sengir
cards.name: Fallen Angel
cards.text:
Flying
Sacrifice a creature: Fallen Angel gets +2/+1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
"What is crueler? To let a wound of the heart fester, or to simply cut it out?"
—Crovax
cards.name: Fatal Blow
cards.text: Destroy target creature that was dealt damage this turn. It can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Fear
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature has fear. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)

cards.flavor:
"Could there be a fouler act? No doubt the baron knows of one."
—Autumn Willow
cards.name: Feast of the Unicorn
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +4/+0.

cards.flavor: Not all shadows are cast by light—some are cast by darkness.
cards.name: Feral Shadow
cards.text: Flying

cards.name: Forbidden Crypt
cards.text:
If you would draw a card, return a card from your graveyard to your hand instead. If you can't, you lose the game.
If a card would be put into your graveyard from anywhere, exile that card instead.

cards.name: Gravebane Zombie
cards.text: If Gravebane Zombie would die, put Gravebane Zombie on top of its owner's library instead.

cards.flavor: A full coffin is like a full coffer—both are attractive to thieves.
cards.name: Gravedigger
cards.text: When Gravedigger enters the battlefield, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.flavor:
"There is no calamity greater than lavish desires. There is no greater guilt than discontentment. And there is no greater disaster than greed."
—Lao Tsu, Tao Te Ching, (trans. Chan)
cards.name: Greed
cards.text: {B}, Pay 2 life: Draw a card.

cards.name: Hecatomb
cards.text:
When Hecatomb enters the battlefield, sacrifice Hecatomb unless you sacrifice four creatures.
Tap an untapped Swamp you control: Hecatomb deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Hidden Horror
cards.text: When Hidden Horror enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you discard a creature card.

cards.name: Howl from Beyond
cards.text: Target creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
"But I signed nothing!"
—Taraneh, Suq'Ata mage
cards.name: Infernal Contract
cards.text: Draw four cards. You lose half your life, rounded up.

cards.flavor:
"They shall drink sorrow's dregs. They shall kill those whom once they loved."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer
cards.name: Kjeldoran Dead
cards.text:
When Kjeldoran Dead enters the battlefield, sacrifice a creature.
{B}: Regenerate Kjeldoran Dead.

cards.flavor:
"Bind me to thee, my soul to thine. I am your servant and your slave. Blood for blood, flesh for flesh, Leshrac, my lord."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer
cards.name: Leshrac's Rite
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has swampwalk. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)

cards.flavor: Her hand gently beckons, she whispers your name—but those who go with her are never the same.
cards.name: Lost Soul
cards.text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)

cards.flavor: The hardest of wizards can have the softest of minds.
cards.name: Mind Warp
cards.text: Look at target player's hand and choose X cards from it. That player discards those cards.

cards.flavor:
"The past is a ghost that haunts you from the moment it exists until the moment you don't."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight
cards.name: Mischievous Poltergeist
cards.text:
Flying
Pay 1 life: Regenerate Mischievous Poltergeist.

cards.name: Necrosavant
cards.text: {3}{B}{B}, Sacrifice a creature: Return Necrosavant from your graveyard to the battlefield. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

cards.flavor: As the poisoned land spreads, so does the nightmare's rage and terrifying strength.
cards.name: Nightmare
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Nightmare's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Swamps you control.

cards.flavor:
"It is terrible how one brief action can live forever in memory."
—Jolrael
cards.name: Painful Memories
cards.text: Look at target opponent's hand and choose a card from it. Put that card on top of that player's library.

cards.flavor:
"There will come a time when the voices of soil and seedling will sing only laments."
—Oracle en-Vec
cards.name: Perish
cards.text: Destroy all green creatures. They can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Pestilence
cards.text:
At the beginning of the end step, if no creatures are on the battlefield, sacrifice Pestilence.
{B}: Pestilence deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.

cards.flavor:
"How can you claim the gods are merciless when they robbed the snake of its limbs to give the other creatures a sporting chance?"
—Hakim, Loreweaver
cards.name: Python

cards.flavor: "Aw, he's just a silly, dirty little man. What's to be afraid of?"
cards.name: Rag Man
cards.text: {B}{B}{B}, {T}: Target opponent reveals his or her hand and discards a creature card at random. Activate this ability only during your turn.

cards.flavor: The earth cannot hold that which magic commands.
cards.name: Raise Dead
cards.text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.flavor:
"Men and rats both hunger: we for our playthings; they, for us."
—Crovax
cards.name: Razortooth Rats
cards.text: Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)

cards.flavor:
"They groaned, they stirred, they all uprose,
Nor spake, nor moved their eyes;
It had been strange, even in a dream,
To have seen those dead men rise."
—Samuel Coleridge,
"The Rime of the Ancient Mariner"
cards.name: Scathe Zombies
Sengir Autocrat
cards.text:
When Sengir Autocrat enters the battlefield, create three 0/1 black Serf creature tokens.
When Sengir Autocrat leaves the battlefield, exile all Serf tokens.

cards.flavor:
"I have seen the night torn into thin darkling strips and woven into shapes too bleak for dreams."
—Crovax
cards.name: Strands of Night
cards.text: {B}{B}, Pay 2 life, Sacrifice a Swamp: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.

cards.flavor: When the alliance between Balduvia and Kjeldor deprived Stromgald of easy victories, its agents were forced to fuel their rituals with their own flesh.
cards.name: Stromgald Cabal
cards.text: {T}, Pay 1 life: Counter target white spell.

cards.flavor:
There are medicines for all afflictions but idleness.
—Suq'Ata saying
cards.name: Stupor
cards.text: Target opponent discards a card at random, then discards a card.

cards.name: Syphon Soul
cards.text: Syphon Soul deals 2 damage to each other player. You gain life equal to the damage dealt this way.

cards.name: Terror
cards.text: Destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.

cards.flavor:
"I write upon clean white parchment with a sharp quill and the blood of my students, divining their secrets."
—Shauku, Endbringer
cards.name: Vampiric Tutor
cards.text: Search your library for a card, then shuffle your library and put that card on top of it. You lose 2 life.

cards.flavor: He controlled the zombies even before his own death; now nothing can make them betray him.
cards.name: Zombie Master
cards.text:
Other Zombie creatures have swampwalk. (They can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
Other Zombies have "{B}: Regenerate this permanent."

cards.flavor:
"You can't get there from here. Well, you can—it just won't be fun."
—Ertai, wizard adept
cards.name: Aether Flash
cards.text: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield, Aether Flash deals 2 damage to it.

cards.flavor:
"Not all minotaurs are tribal. Some are freelance."
—Eron the Relentless
cards.name: Anaba Bodyguard
cards.text: First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)

cards.flavor:
"The shamans? Ha! They are craven cows not capable of true magic."
—Irini Sengir
cards.name: Anaba Shaman
cards.text: {R}, {T}: Anaba Shaman deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.flavor:
"Barbarian raids were a concern to those living in the northwest provinces, but the skyknights never dealt with the problem in a systematic way. They thought of the Balduvians as an ‘amusing model' of their forebears' culture."
—Kjeldor: Ice Civilization
cards.name: Balduvian Barbarians
Balduvian Horde
cards.text: When Balduvian Horde enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you discard a card at random.

cards.flavor: Fire never dies alone.

cards.flavor:
"The fishers will throw out their nets and draw them back filled with dust."
—Oracle en-Vec

cards.name: Burrowing

Enchant creature

cards.flavor:
"Why do we trade with those despicable elves? You don't live in forests, you burn them!"
—Avram Garrisson,
Leader of the Knights of Stromgald

Enchant land
You control enchanted land.

cards.flavor:
"Dragonfire forged me a warrior."
—Rashida Scalebane

Flying

cards.text: Earthquake deals X damage to each creature without flying and each player.

cards.flavor:
"If your blood doesn't run hot, I will make it run in the sands!"
—Maraxus of Keld
cards.name: Fervor

cards.flavor:
Want all, lose all.
—Zhalfirin aphorism
cards.name: Final Fortune
cards.text: Take an extra turn after this one. At the beginning of that turn's end step, you lose the game.

cards.flavor: Fire elementals are ruthless infernos, annihilating and consuming their foes in a frenzied holocaust. Crackling and blazing, they sear swift, terrible paths, leaving the land charred and scorched in their wake.
cards.name: Fire Elemental

cards.flavor:
"Magic's only part of it, my friend. Diet does the rest."
—Suq'Ata trader
cards.name: Firebreathing
cards.text:
Enchant creature
{R}: Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
"Anger is fleeting; remorse is eternal."
—Karn, silver golem
cards.name: Fit of Rage
cards.text: Target creature gets +3/+3 and gains first strike until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
"The spirit of the flame is the spirit of change."
—Lovisa Coldeyes,
Balduvian chieftain
cards.name: Flame Spirit
cards.text: {R}: Flame Spirit gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Flashfires
cards.text: Destroy all Plains.

cards.flavor:
"O! it is excellent / To have a giant's strength, but it is tyrannous / To use it like a giant."
—William Shakespeare,
Measure for Measure
cards.name: Giant Strength
cards.text:
Enchant creature

cards.flavor:
"From down here we can make the whole wall collapse!"
"Uh, yeah, boss, but how do we get out?"
cards.name: Goblin Digging Team
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Goblin Digging Team: Destroy target Wall.

cards.flavor: They talk a good fight.
cards.name: Goblin Elite Infantry
cards.text: Whenever Goblin Elite Infantry blocks or becomes blocked, it gets -1/-1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
"When you're a goblin, you don't have to step forward to be a hero—everyone else just has to step back!"
—Biggum Flodrot, goblin veteran
cards.name: Goblin Hero

cards.flavor: To be king, Numsgil did in Blog, who did in Unkful, who did in Viddle, who did in Loll, who did in Alrok . . . ."
cards.name: Goblin King
cards.text: Other Goblin creatures get +1/+1 and have mountainwalk. (They can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)

cards.flavor: "Next!"
cards.name: Goblin Recruiter
cards.text: When Goblin Recruiter enters the battlefield, search your library for any number of Goblin cards and reveal those cards. Shuffle your library, then put them on top of it in any order.

cards.flavor: "Goblins bred underground, their numbers hidden from the enemy until it was too late." —Sarpadian Empires, vol. IV
cards.name: Goblin Warrens
cards.text: {2}{R}, Sacrifice two Goblins: Create three 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens.

cards.name: Hammer of Bogardan

{2}{R}{R}{R}: Return Hammer of Bogardan from your graveyard to your hand. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

cards.flavor: Anyone can get around a cyclops, but few can stand in its way.
cards.name: Hulking Cyclops
cards.text: Hulking Cyclops can't block.

cards.name: Illicit Auction
cards.text: Each player may bid life for control of target creature. You start the bidding with a bid of 0. In turn order, each player may top the high bid. The bidding ends if the high bid stands. The high bidder loses life equal to the high bid and gains control of the creature. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)

cards.flavor: "Some have said there is no subtlety to destruction. You know what? They're dead." —Jaya Ballard, task mage
cards.name: Inferno
cards.text: Inferno deals 6 damage to each creature and each player.

cards.flavor:
"The raging waters had swept away trees, bridges, and even houses. My healers had much work to do."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran priest
cards.name: Jokulhaups

cards.flavor:
"Those who fear the darkness have never seen what the light can do."
—Selenia, dark angel

cards.text: Whenever a player taps a land for mana, Manabarbs deals 1 damage to that player.

cards.flavor: Only the heroic and the mad follow mountain goat trails.
cards.name: Mountain Goat
cards.text: Mountainwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)

cards.flavor: In a rare display of ingenuity, the orcs invented an incredibly destructive weapon. Most orcish artillerists are those who dared criticize its effectiveness.

cards.text: {T}: Orcish Artillery deals 2 damage to target creature or player and 3 damage to you.

cards.name: Orcish Oriflamme
cards.text: Attacking creatures you control get +1/+0.

cards.name: Pillage
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or land. It can't be regenerated.

cards.flavor:
"Hi!ni!ya! Behold the man of flint, that's me! / Four lightnings zigzag from me, strike and return."
—Navajo war chant
cards.name: Pyrotechnics
cards.text: Pyrotechnics deals 4 damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures and/or players.

cards.flavor: He raged at the world, at his family, at his life. But mostly he just raged.
cards.name: Raging Goblin

cards.flavor: Many mages have been consumed by their work.
cards.name: Reckless Embermage
cards.text: {1}{R}: Reckless Embermage deals 1 damage to target creature or player and 1 damage to itself.

cards.flavor:
"Flog and Squee / Up the tree / See the army / Flee, flee, flee."
—Goblin nursery rhyme/war cry
cards.name: Relentless Assault
cards.text: Untap all creatures that attacked this turn. After this main phase, there is an additional combat phase followed by an additional main phase.

cards.flavor:
"I fear anything with teeth measured in handspans!"
—Norin the Wary

cards.text: First strike

cards.name: Shatter
cards.text: Destroy target artifact.

cards.flavor: Chains of leaping fire and sizzling lightning laid waste the artificers' handiwork, sparing not a single device.

cards.text: Destroy all artifacts. They can't be regenerated.

cards.flavor:
Lightning tethers souls to the world.
—Kor saying

cards.flavor: It prefers its meals cooked.
cards.name: Spitting Drake

Flying

cards.flavor:
"There are times solid ground gives precious little comfort."

Don't insult a Talruum unless your mount is swift.

"Where do you run when the earth becomes your enemy?"
—Naimag, Femeref philosopher

cards.flavor:
"I saw the wizard gesturing, but I didn't guess his plan until my aesthir cried out and went into a dive."
—Arna Kennerüd, skyknight

cards.text: Vertigo deals 2 damage to target creature with flying. That creature loses flying until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
"When traveling the Great Desert avoid wearing the scales of lizards, for the Viashino rule the sands and look poorly on the skinning of their cousins."
—Zhalfirin Guide to the Desert

cards.flavor: Speed and fire are always a deadly combination.

cards.text:
Flying
Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)

cards.flavor:
My thunder comes before the lightning; my lightning comes before the clouds; my rain dries all the land it touches. What am I?
—Femeref riddle
cards.name: Volcanic Geyser
cards.text: Volcanic Geyser deals X damage to target creature or player.

cards.flavor:
"Struggle, and you will only fan the flames."
—Talibah, embermage

Defender (This creature can't attack.)

cards.name: Birds of Paradise
cards.text:
Flying

cards.flavor: Thinking of dinner made Squee realize that the forest was probably thinking the same thing.
cards.name: Call of the Wild
cards.text: {2}{G}{G}: Reveal the top card of your library. If it's a creature card, put it onto the battlefield. Otherwise, put it into your graveyard.

cards.flavor: These stealthy felines have survived so many battles that some believe they must possess many lives.
cards.name: Cat Warriors

cards.flavor:
"Mold could catch you."
—Suq'Ata insult
cards.name: Creeping Mold
cards.text: Destroy target artifact, enchantment, or land.

cards.flavor:
"Big plants not only good for hidin', but full o' tasty bugs, too."
—Squee, goblin cabin hand
cards.name: Dense Foliage
cards.text: Creatures can't be the targets of spells.

cards.flavor:
"Tonight we'll eat a farewell feast. Cold corn porridge is not enough. / Let's peel papayas, pineapples, and mangoes, drink coconut milk, / and bake bananas."
—"Love Song of Night and Day"
cards.name: Early Harvest
cards.text: Target player untaps all basic lands he or she controls.

cards.flavor:
"Did clouds dance in his eyes,
did thorns play at his fingertips?"
—Shesul Fass, faerie bard
cards.name: Elder Druid
cards.text: {3}{G}, {T}: You may tap or untap target artifact, creature, or land.

cards.flavor: Elves know where to harvest the best of the forest, for they planted it there themselves.
cards.name: Elven Cache
cards.text: Return target card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.flavor:
Sometimes it is better to be swift of foot than strong of swordarm.
—Elven proverb
cards.name: Elven Riders
cards.text: Elven Riders can't be blocked except by Walls and/or creatures with flying.

cards.flavor: "I tell you, there was so many arrows flying about you couldn't hardly see the sun. So I says to young Angus, ‘Well, at least now we're fighting in the shade!'"
cards.name: Elvish Archers
cards.text: First strike

cards.flavor:
". . . and when the farmer awoke the next morning, all the seeds from his field were once again in their sacks."
—Afari, Tales
cards.name: Fallow Earth
cards.text: Put target land on top of its owner's library.

cards.flavor:
"I'd rather fight on foreign soil. That way, if I lose I can blame it on the terrain."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight
cards.name: Familiar Ground
cards.text: Each creature you control can't be blocked by more than one creature.

cards.flavor:
"They say a Zhalfirin archer can split the eye of a griffin. Nonsense, of course; they have no faith to guide their darts."
—Nuru, Femeref archer
cards.name: Femeref Archers
cards.text: {T}: Femeref Archers deals 4 damage to target attacking creature with flying.

cards.name: Fog
cards.text: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.

cards.flavor:
"I've been insulted by drunks in a hundred inns, but never as skillfully or annoyingly as by those blasted brownies."
—General Jarkeld, the Arctic Fox
cards.name: Fyndhorn Brownie
cards.text: {2}{G}, {T}: Untap target creature.

cards.flavor:
"Do we know what we're doing? Yes—the will of Freyalise."
—Laina of the Elvish Council

cards.text: {T}: Add {G}{G} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Giant Growth
cards.text: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: It's not far into the trap, as the crow flies.

cards.flavor:
"In the soil of leadership sprout the seeds of immortality."
—Kaysa, Elder Druid of the Juniper

cards.flavor: Don't try to outrun one of Dominaria's grizzlies; it'll catch you, knock you down, and eat you. Of course, you could run up a tree. In that case you'll get a nice view before it knocks the tree down and eats you.
cards.name: Grizzly Bears

cards.text: All Forests are 1/1 creatures that are still lands.

One bone broken for every twig snapped underfoot.
—Llanowar penalty for trespassing

cards.flavor: No two see the same Maro.

cards.flavor:
Spring follows winter
—Elvish expression meaning
"all things pass"

cards.flavor: The dogs of war are nothing compared to the cats.

cards.flavor:
"A mysterious people indeed. Their origins are as secret as their traditions."
—Lord Magnus of Llanowar

cards.text: {T}: Target creature loses flying until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Rath forces plants from its surface as one presses whey from cheese.

cards.flavor: The soldiers chopped and chopped, and still the great tree stood, frowning down at them.

Regeneration
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
{G}: Regenerate enchanted creature. (The next time that creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)

cards.flavor:
"But no one heard the snake's gentle hiss for peace over the elephant's trumpeting of war."
—Afari, Tales
cards.name: River Boa
cards.text:
Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)
{G}: Regenerate River Boa.

cards.flavor:
"I've dreamt of a second harvest but fear I will not see it."
—Asmira, holy avenger
cards.name: Rowen
cards.text: Reveal the first card you draw each turn. Whenever you reveal a basic land card this way, draw a card.

cards.flavor:
"Flourishing during the Ice Age, these wurms were the bane of all Kjeldorans. Their great size and ferocity made them the subject of countless nightmares—they embodied the worst of the Ice Age."
—Kjeldor: Ice Civilization
cards.name: Scaled Wurm

cards.flavor: Moving without sound, swift figures pass through branches and undergrowth completely unhindered. One with the trees around them, the dryads of Shanodin Forest are seen only when they wish to be.
cards.name: Shanodin Dryads
cards.text: Forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)

cards.flavor: In the Jamuraan jungles, there is often no separating beauty from danger.

cards.text: Stalking Tiger can't be blocked by more than one creature.

cards.flavor: Summer sends its kiss with warmth and blooming life.

cards.flavor: Moss-covered statues littered the area, a macabre monument to the basilisk's terrible power.

cards.flavor: These are its last days. Better to grow broad and heavy. Better that the enemy is crushed beneath its carcass.

cards.text: Destroy all enchantments.

"Is it true that the apes wear furs of gold when they marry?"
—Rana, Suq'Ata market fool

"To pass through the jungle: silence, courtesy, ferocity, as the occasion demands."
—Kamau, "Proper Passage"

Forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)

cards.text: Search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

cards.flavor: Some say magic was first practiced by women, who have always felt strong ties to the land.

cards.text: Whenever you cast an enchantment spell, you may draw a card.

cards.flavor:
"After waking to the magic of Llanowar, no dreams can compare."
—Mirri of the Weatherlight

cards.flavor: The trees have ears, eyes, and teeth.

cards.text: Each player creates a 1/1 green Cat creature token for each untapped Forest he or she controls.

cards.flavor:
"Too much work—it takes a long time to break them in, and more than a few recruits."
—Grebog, goblin swine-rider

cards.flavor:
"Aselbo soon had the rhino eating from his palm and the snake waiting at his heels."
—Afari, Tales

cards.text: Search your library for a creature card and reveal that card. Shuffle your library, then put the card on top of it.

cards.flavor:
"When one wolf calls, others follow. Who wants to fight creatures that eat scorpions?"
—Maimun al-Wyluli, diary

cards.text: {T}: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
". . . The magician drew a ring off his finger . . . , saying: 'It is a talisman against all evil, so long as you obey me.'"
—The Arabian Nights,
Junior Classics trans.
cards.name: Aladdin's Ring
cards.text: {8}, {T}: Aladdin's Ring deals 4 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Amber Prison
cards.text:
You may choose not to untap Amber Prison during your untap step.
{4}, {T}: Tap target artifact, creature, or land. That permanent doesn't untap during its controller's untap step for as long as Amber Prison remains tapped.

cards.flavor: Tawnos finally cracked the puzzle: the strange structures did not house Mishra's malevolent creations but were themselves among his creations.
cards.name: Ankh of Mishra
cards.text: Whenever a land enters the battlefield, Ankh of Mishra deals 2 damage to that land's controller.

cards.flavor: The Brothers' War scarred the land, but Ashnod left her mark in the bloodlines of those she tortured.
cards.name: Ashnod's Altar
cards.text: Sacrifice a creature: Add {C}{C} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Bottle of Suleiman
cards.text: {1}, Sacrifice Bottle of Suleiman: Flip a coin. If you win the flip, create a 5/5 colorless Djinn artifact creature token with flying. If you lose the flip, Bottle of Suleiman deals 5 damage to you.

cards.name: Charcoal Diamond
cards.text:
Charcoal Diamond enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {B} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Crystal Rod
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a blue spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.

cards.flavor:
Pass me from soul to soul, / soldier to herder, herder to beast, beast to soil / until I am everywhere. / Then pass me those souls.
—Totem inscription (translated)
cards.name: Cursed Totem
cards.text: Activated abilities of creatures can't be activated.

cards.flavor: Bobbing merrily from opponent to opponent, the scimitar began adding playful little flourishes to its strokes; it even turned a couple of somersaults.
cards.name: Dancing Scimitar
cards.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)

cards.name: Dingus Egg
cards.text: Whenever a land is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, Dingus Egg deals 2 damage to that land's controller.

cards.name: Disrupting Scepter
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Target player discards a card. Activate this ability only during your turn.

cards.flavor:
"How is it the legged engines seem so much more alive than their wheeled counterparts? Simply, they were born, not made."
—Mishra
cards.name: Dragon Engine
cards.text: {2}: Dragon Engine gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
"With no further options, I was forced to don the mask."
—Rashida Scalebane
cards.name: Dragon Mask
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Target creature you control gets +2/+2 until end of turn. Return it to its owner's hand at the beginning of the next end step. (Return it only if it's on the battlefield.)

cards.name: Fire Diamond
cards.text:
Fire Diamond enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {R} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Flying Carpet
cards.text: {2}, {T}: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.

cards.flavor: The fountain had stood in the town square for centuries, but only the pigeons knew its secret.
cards.name: Fountain of Youth
cards.text: {2}, {T}: You gain 1 life.

cards.name: Glasses of Urza
cards.text: {T}: Look at target player's hand.

cards.name: Grinning Totem
cards.text: {2}, {T}, Sacrifice Grinning Totem: Search target opponent's library for a card and exile it. Then that player shuffles his or her library. Until the beginning of your next upkeep, you may play that card. At the beginning of your next upkeep, if you haven't played it, put it into its owner's graveyard.

cards.name: Howling Mine
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's draw step, if Howling Mine is untapped, that player draws an additional card.

cards.name: Iron Star
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a red spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.

cards.name: Ivory Cup
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a white spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.

cards.name: Jade Monolith
cards.text: {1}: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to target creature this turn, that source deals that damage to you instead.

cards.flavor: This timeworn relic was responsible for many of Urza's victories, though he never fully comprehended its mystic runes.
cards.name: Jalum Tome
cards.text: {2}, {T}: Draw a card, then discard a card.

cards.name: Jayemdae Tome
cards.text: {4}, {T}: Draw a card.

cards.flavor: Slow and heavy swings the club.
cards.name: Lead Golem
cards.text: Whenever Lead Golem attacks, it doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.

cards.name: Mana Prism
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{1}, {T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

cards.name: Marble Diamond
cards.text:
Marble Diamond enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {W} to your mana pool.

cards.flavor: When the mighty sleep, the lowly prowl.
cards.name: Meekstone
cards.text: Creatures with power 3 or greater don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.

cards.flavor: More than one mage has been driven insane by the sound of the millstone relentlessly grinding away.
cards.name: Millstone
cards.text: {2}, {T}: Target player puts the top two cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

cards.name: Moss Diamond
cards.text:
Moss Diamond enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Mystic Compass
cards.text: {1}, {T}: Target land becomes the basic land type of your choice until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
"The foot stone is connected to the ankle stone, the ankle stone is connected to the leg stone . . . ."
—"Song of the Artificer"
cards.name: Obsianus Golem

cards.flavor:
"It has been my honor to improve on the Thran's original design. Perhaps history will remember me in some small part for my work."
—Urza, in his apprenticeship
cards.name: Ornithopter
cards.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)

cards.flavor: It scattered falcons like a lion hunting among jackals.
cards.name: Patagia Golem
cards.text: {3}: Patagia Golem gains flying until end of turn.

cards.flavor: A mirror, a shield, a promise, a great distance, and a kind word—five ways to avoid harm.
cards.name: Pentagram of the Ages
cards.text: {4}, {T}: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

cards.flavor:
"The secrets of Phyrexia are expensive. You will pay in brass and bone, steel and sinew."
—Kaervek
cards.name: Phyrexian Vault
cards.text: {2}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Draw a card.

cards.name: Primal Clay
cards.text: As Primal Clay enters the battlefield, it becomes your choice of a 3/3 artifact creature, a 2/2 artifact creature with flying, or a 1/6 Wall artifact creature with defender in addition to its other types. (A creature with defender can't attack.)

cards.name: Rod of Ruin
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Rod of Ruin deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.flavor:
"What manner of fiend would design such a sadistic device?"
—Sorine Relicbane, Soldevi heretic
cards.name: Skull Catapult
cards.text: {1}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Skull Catapult deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Sky Diamond
cards.text:
Sky Diamond enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {U} to your mana pool.

cards.flavor:
"Uh, does anyone have a flute?"
—Rana, Suq'Ata market fool
cards.name: Snake Basket
cards.text: {X}, Sacrifice Snake Basket: Create X 1/1 green Snake creature tokens. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

cards.name: Soul Net
cards.text: Whenever a creature dies, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.

cards.name: Storm Cauldron
cards.text:
Each player may play an additional land during each of his or her turns.
Whenever a land is tapped for mana, return it to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Teferi's Puzzle Box
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's draw step, that player puts the cards in his or her hand on the bottom of his or her library in any order, then draws that many cards.

cards.flavor: Mouths and wings beyond numbering, but a single mind to guide them.
cards.name: The Hive
cards.text: {5}, {T}: Create a 1/1 colorless Insect artifact creature token with flying named Wasp. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)

cards.name: Throne of Bone
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a black spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.

cards.flavor: You'll never miss what you never had.
cards.name: Wand of Denial
cards.text: {T}: Look at the top card of target player's library. If it's a nonland card, you may pay 2 life. If you do, put it into that player's graveyard.

cards.name: Wooden Sphere
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a green spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.

{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.

{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
